Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: Special Thanks to Nurdin for making our stay very hospitable and comfortable. We had a fantastic time at Patricia, the area seems dodgy but in reality it is a safe place, and great location not too far from downtown. The staff are very friendly, helpful and respectful. There is a pub joined to the hotel with live music almost every night! What more could you ask for? Look forward to returning, Anna and James

Reviews.Title: “Patricia is traveler' s & globtrotter's first choice”
Reviews.Author: tana_detlef
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of a major tourist side and with budget in mind this is the place to be. East Hasting Street is a absolutly must see for every traveler and visitor of Vancouver. Everybody will find out by himself what East Hasting means and tells.Pure education! Without walking twice the East Hasting you can't even say you have been in Vancouver. Yes, there are some homeless people,a few women and so on.Some bodies look strange or funny. But it is safe to walk there any time and nobody trouble you or ask for change,what is happen more in the city center.During my 5 weeks stay I had no problem at all. Also is easy to walk the Pender Street in interesting China Town just 70 m from the Hotel and avoid the Hasting if you like. The Hotel got a nicely decorated big lobby and the staff is very friendly and can tell you about Vancouver all you wan't to know. Mr.Noordin(reception) always like to explain everyting with patience. Unbeatable location.Very closed to the center.Walking distance. The view from my room 502 fifth floor is gorgeous!Skyline,mountains and sea and the never boring unique street view is more than worth the little money extra.Room service is doing well always friendly with a smile.Police museum is near. The last week I was parking my car at the hotel's parking lot also without any problem. So really I don't understand the review' s of some guest's.Maby they are from countryside. This is Vancouver and not Johannesburg!So don't worry at all.I guess it is more dangerous in a barbershop then to walk the Hasting Street. When I'm back in Vancouver without a doubt I will stay in Patricia again and can recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Budget inn Patricia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Budget inn Patricia Hotel was good compared to the price. about the location: it is a bad neighbourhood, but good distance to downtown. would recommend Powel street, if your walking home from downtown at night..

Reviews.Title: “BAD AREA- THE SKID ROW OF VANCOUVER”
Reviews.Author: ziggz43
Reviews.Content: taxi driver told us it was a bad area, we didnt know it was this bad. As soon as we turned on Hastings Ave we saw a few hookers, bums everywhere. When we tried to check in they charged us even though we were booked with travelocity. I was worried bout that, but travelocity did not end up charging us so that worked out. When we got to the room it smelled bad, MILDEW! Turned on fan, opened window with no screen to let air out. Even with that didnt help after hours. Bathroom was size of small closet, broken floor tiles, old furniture. Pub was rundown and dirty. When we went outside there were teenagers smoking crack on the street. Horrible visit to beautiful vancouver!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant too stay at the Patricia Hotel but after reading very good reviews decided to give it a go. We were not disappointed. Yes it is on the rougher side of town but just think of it as a cultural experience. Being close to china town means meals on the cheap and as it is on a main bus route you can be in the centre of town in about 5 minutes. If you don't feel like heading out you can always stay in and have a meal at Pat's pub down stairs which also has great value meals and it's own micro brewery. The Hotel its self was kept immaculate and the staff at the front desk were always incredibly helpful, going over and above the levels of service to ensure your stay is as comfortable and insightful as possible. A special thanks too Noordin and Lindsay for your excellent service. I would recommend the Patricia Hotel to couples travelling on a budget not looking to spend all there time cramped in a rowdy backpackers. It is definitely among the BEST value Hotels in Vancouver City.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne P
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. This is a funky old hotel, furniture somewhat shopworn, and the neighborhood a bit seedy. That said, it was also clean, comfortable, easy access to lots of restaurants, sights, and activities. The staff was incredibly welcoming and helpful and the pub was cozy and pleasant. Good price too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't mind theUndesirables”
Reviews.Author: Entre_Amis
Reviews.Content: Ridiculous review about bed bugs. The price is right, location is excellent, and frankly I don't understand the "terrible" ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: What a nice place to stay if your business in within the city. I stayed here for close to two weeks and never regreted any moment of my stay. True, as others have already stated, the neighborhood is not your normal safe-looking, there are all these homeless fellows, druggies and prostitutes, but non of those interfered with my stay. I had quiet nights throughout. Apart from the main street on which the hotel is located, all the other streets in the neighborhood are clean.The staff are particularly awesome; they are just too friendly. I was able to walk to many of the places I wanted to go to from the hotel. Chinaworld is only ten minutes walk from the hotel. I will definately choose the hotel anytime I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for well-seasoned travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ande w
Reviews.Content: The Patricia is absolutely the best budget hotel deal in Vancouver. For just a little more cash than you would pay for a dorm bed in a depressing, dingy hostel like C&N or the American you get your own room with a comfy double bed, warm shower, free wifi and cable TV. The staff is also really friendly and if you don't want to wander too far at night the pub downstairs has great live music and good beer. Try finding a deal like this in any other world-class city such as New York City or San Francisco. Yes, the surrounding neighborhood is colorful but luckily Vancouver has some of the nicest and most harmless street people anywhere. The others on here complaining are probably not experienced travelers who know a good deal when they see it, because the Patricia Hotel is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: Depending on your expectations, the Patricia can be a good place to stay. True, it's location or actually it's neighborhood, isn't the best. But you get just what they promise-a small room in an old hotel which is clean and comfortable. Our stay happened to coincide with a heat wave in Vancouver, and the Patricia isn't air conditioned. The provided fan helped, but it was still warm in the room during the day. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in arranging local tours. We felt very safe walking in the neighborhood; the various homeless people did not bother or harass us. For a 98 year old hotel, the Patricia is very affordable, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lulaslk
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights. It is really old and creepy but the worst is outside!!it is very close to downtown but you have to walk through homeless and drugaddicts and prostitutes...It is very scary at night although nobody did anything against us.

Reviews.Title: “Great... if you like bedbugs and crack heads....”
Reviews.Author: HelenFromUK T
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE I just got out of this hotel alive.... I have about 30 bed bug bites and probably plague or something. The other reviews on this site, well the good ones at least are NOT accurate. The area around the hotel is hell on earth, there are homeless / druggies / prostitues / down and outs as far as you can see around the outside of the hotel. I relaly did not feel safe walking to downtown even in the day. There is one block where there must be a shelter or something and the street is just lined with these people. As for the hotel itself.... the interior is not that bad, the room has everything you need (and a few extra guests you don't), the bathroom was small but functional, there was a tv (which was rather old and about 30% of the screen was permenantly tinted green). There are towels etc provided which is a bonus. As for the bugs.....I have stayed in a lot of hotels all over the world (50+) and this is the first time I have EVER encountered bed bugs. On the 2nd day of my stay I was feeling a little itchy and uncomfortable but I thought that it may be from travelling or the change in weather and thought nothing further. On the third day I noticed some red ‘bites’ on my legs and back, I thought that they were caused by mosquitos or similar as I had been to Stanley Park. I am not from here so I thought that it was some local bug. Finally on the 5th and final night of my stay I was lying in the bed awake when I felt something crawling and to my horror saw a bug crawling across the bed. I have never been so disgusted in all my life. I googled what it was as as I said previously I had no idea what a bed bug even looked like and to my horror my research confirmed. As quickly as I could I packed my stuff and went to reception. The girl on reception did not seem shocked or bothered by what I was telling her and suggested it was my own fault?! While I understand that bugs can be transmitted by clothes etc I do not feel that this is the appropriate attitude for dealing with a distressed guest very early in the morning. Be your own judge... but take my advice and pay more for somewhere 1/2 decent!!

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonably priced Hotel with super Staff”
Reviews.Author: ronan b
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in Hotel Patricia. It was a great Hotel in one of the nicest cities i have ever visited. When i booked into the Hotel i asked the manager on duty what sights he could recommend for a first time visitor of Vancouver. Whilst he could have told me to take a look at the numerous brochures advertsing local tours in the hotel lobby he spent about 20 minutes writing down local places of interest for me to visit. These were great places off the normal tourist track. The hotel was extremely clean and was also nice and quiet. It is also only located about 1 km from the downtown area which meant that there was no need to use taxis. There was even a bar downstairs which was pretty cool. However whilst all staff members were particularly courteous, one particular staff member Lindsay stood out. Having left the hotel i discovered that i had left me camcorder behind. The camcorder contained all two weeks of my holiday footage. I had travelled from Ireland to see Killer whales in the wild and was pretty upset when i left my camcorder in the hotel. Well Lindsay located the camcorder and spent some time looking for the most competitive quote to get the camcorder returned to me in Ireland. All in all i had a great time in Vancouver and would certainly recommend Hotel Patricia to anybody who is looking for a very reasonably priced hotel close to all the attractions. Ronan Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Staff was helpful/accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: tnoccther
Reviews.Content: Local area was a little scary, but guard in parking lot (free parking) was very helpful. Had to take everything out of vehicle which was a pain, especially since we were packed for a month. All kinds of homeless people were walking up and down the street. Room was small but clean. Price was reasonable. Beds were so-so. Room was a little hot and a fan was provided. This is not a five star hotel, but it is OK...not sure if I would stay here again or not.

Reviews.Title: “Economical”
Reviews.Author: plfcowgirlval
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dated but clean & affordable. The desk clerk was very friendly & helpful. Our room was very tiny but if all you need is a place to lie your head, this will work. Within walking distance of town & docks. Although I felt perfectly safe in the hotel, I will warn you, do not walk straight down Hastings St. into town. There are a lot of alcoholics, drug users & homeless on most of this street. Just walk one block over to head towards town.

Reviews.Title: “The area...”
Reviews.Author: MD-11P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Patricia for one night in August and I must say that the area is really somewhat unpleasant. We arrived and just parked to drop off the suitcases. As soon as we got out of the car two prostitutes approached us, looking for business. They are all over hastings street, as well as drugged persons and homeless people. Walking the area at night we found rather unpleasant due to these people, using drugs on the street. Eventually we entered Chinatown, which was a lot more pleasant, and chances where that the Keefer Street night market was open, a very nice experience. The room itself provided all one needs but no more. One double bed, that just fit into the room, a cabinet with shower and toilet ensuite where the door could only be closed properly from the outside and a sink beside the door. It seemed quite clean overall but might require some renovation work. Breakfast at Pat's pub is just what one would expect from a Canadian or american hotel: toast with jam, peanut butter or Nutella, muffins and cereal. Coffe and Tea are also provided. The staff was helpful and kind, never losing ther professionality. Would I recommend Patricia? Hard to say. Definetely not to female singles but if you are looking for a cheap acommodation with good bus connections this is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff changed my view of the hotel and the area. I would come back.”
Reviews.Author: s s
Reviews.Content: The Hotel: It is early-1900's style so the rooms are smaller and it would be too expensive to upgrade certain amenities (like A/C) without destroying much of the foundation to this landmark. The rooms are CLEAN, the toiletries are refreshed and the shower has fantastic pressure. The location is unfortunate but its only the East Hastings Street side which would make one feel uneasy. If you come to the hotel from ANY OTHER direction, you are in for a historic, eclectic experience and good-eats as well. It's close to everything and accessible by EVERY mode of transportation within a few minutes walk. There is a bus stop about 15 steps from the hotel entrance. The Staff: Incredibly knowledgeable of the area, their surroundings, and the reviews given here. Upon arrival, they take the time to explain how to navigate the surrounding areas, where to go and what to do. I had a wonderful experience with all the staff during my stay. The Pub: Awesome food, beer and atmosphere for the price. period. My only caveats are that the elevator may not work all the time and there are open hallway windows. these are both due to the age of the building but present no real dangers. beware of taxis coming to pick you up from the hotel. some may not quote fair prices from the hotel to the airport/rail station. make sure their taxi meter works! If you want to save money, have sense not to bother or chastise/judge strangers and have basic street smarts, then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I got what I paid for.”
Reviews.Author: meegs1982
Reviews.Content: First of all, the price is so fantastic that I wish there was a Budget Inn Patricia in every city in the world! At $40 (ish) a night for one person, this hotel is actually better value than any hostel in the city, which charge around $25 for just a bed in a dorm or approximately $60 for a single room (and then you get to lug your belongings up and down flights of stairs). I spent about ten nights at the Budget Inn Patricia while I was in between other accommodations in Vancouver, which meant I had a lot of personal belongings: 3 suitcases full, actually. Upon arrival, I was immediately assisted by a gentleman who came out to the taxi to help me and my stuff inside. When she saw how much luggage I had, the front desk girl was lovely enough to upgrade me to a bigger room, free of charge. The room was small, but perfectly adequate for one person and three suitcases. It had a shower and toilet in a little ensuite, with the basin in the room. The TV worked and had a great selection of channels. The bedding and towels were clean and shampoo and soap were provided. There was a radiator to heat the room and there was a small pedistal fan that I imagine would be very helpful in summer. I never ate at the pub downstairs, prefering to walk to Gastown or China Town for meals, or just ate snacks in the room. The surrounding area is filled with homeless people, but I never felt scared, mostly sad or guilty. Because of this, I quickly learnt I could avoid the situation by walking along just one street parallel to East Hastings. Bus stops are so close that you don't have to walk far if you don't want to. I took advantage of the very cheap laundry during my stay. The laundry room was very clean and well maintained. Like the hotel itself, the cheapest I've seen anywhere. If money isn't a problem for you or you care about the small stuff, then there are plenty of beautiful and more expensive hotels in the city to suit you. In the case of the Budget Inn Patricia, you definately get what you pay for (perhaps even a little more).

Reviews.Title: “Poor safety, very dodgy area, close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: nicolad100
Reviews.Content: as we walked from the underground station to the hotel in the middle of the afternoon we passed groups of homeless people, strong smells of cannibis and all sorts of other interesting people! as we got closer to the hotel we passed one women sitting on the pavement shotting up with heroin from a kinder egg cup. a nice start to the break! the reception staff were friendly and helpful, the room was basic but clean and shower was hot and powerful. we were on the 5th floor, the large sash window opened all the way - no safety on it and didnt seem to lock in anyway and there was a fire escape just outside. some floors on the hotel stunk of cannibis and sometimes when we had the window open (had to wedge it open with a book and took both us us to lift it open) the smell wafted in too. we paid $80 per night for two of us for b and b. you do get what you pay for, my only concern was the safety, seemingly anyone could walk in off the street and head straight for the lifts and staircase.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: kiwi369
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this place again. We got there and were checked in to our room from the grumpy reception staff, the room they gave hadnt been cleaned from the previous guests, So they changed the room no problem and it was fine. genually you get what you pay for at cheap hotels but for $112.00 a night it was crap. wasnt really that clean,we heard everything from the rooms on both sides of us and above and inthe hallways. the "shower nozel" had no cradle so you had to hold it while showering, not so easy!! breakfast was not to bad and the meals at the on site pud were cheap and prety decent aswell. Its the dozens of homeless people who camp outside on the side walks day and night that is a real put off. have to walk through them all to walk into town or even get to the bus stop to bus to town. If you do stay here anyway you get free wifi, breakfast is free and if you dont mind the homeless camp its about a 10/5min walk into down town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good service”
Reviews.Author: Dens2557
Reviews.Content: No complain with this hotel because it's clean( old as well) and lobby's people are really nice. A little noisy during the night Poor people in the area but well located and not far from downtown

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value”
Reviews.Author: KJH_LS6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for over a week in June to do a bit of sightseeing and attend a conference in Vancouver Convention Centre. I had excellent service from the staff in the dealings I had with them, and the hotel itself seemed completely divorced from the outside world – an oasis of calm and normality in comparison to life on East Hastings. The room on the 4th floor was perfectly reasonable, it lacked a separate table which would be awkward for those expecting to do some work, but I could forgive that given the price considering some of my colleagues were spending maybe 5x or more per night for alternative hotels. On the ground floor at the back & side they have their associated Pat’s Pub, I sampled a fair bit of the food and they do very good burgers and fish and chips at a very good price, along with their own lager which was excellent. The only reservation I might have is if you were in a room on the 1st floor above the pub, I would hope there is decent soundproofing considering some of the live bands they host later in the evenings. The location is about 25 minutes walk from the convention centre. It’s safe to say there’s nothing quite like East Hastings Street anywhere else in the numerous cities throughout the world I’ve stayed in, I’ve never seen so many homeless and down and outs anywhere else, and there’s certainly a haunt for prostitutes on Dunlevy between East Hastings and East Cordova, so keep your eyes averted or expect to be propositioned if you’re a single guy. But in the times I walked East Hastings including carrying my laptop and rucksack on arriving and leaving I was never bothered by anyone and felt perfectly safe. Those who wish to avoid these sections of humanity could easily do so by walking down Dunlevy Avenue to East Pender Street and walk in through Chinatown which is like a different world. It’s amazing how the character of an area can change in such a short distance. Given the value represented by this hotel, I can definitely recommend it and would have no hesitation in staying there again when I next go to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Secret In Town”
Reviews.Author: idolovebubbles
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the Olympics and again for game 7 of the Playoffs...Quick walk to town without spending a fortune. The Pat Pub was a real surprise, food was amazing (try the sheperds pie)! The rooms, small, clean and quaint and the staff were so hospitable. Specialty coffee machine in the lobby a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doug T
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here in East Hastings. The hotel has a large table in the lobby you can read at or take your food there to enjoy. Reception is very pleasent, good peoplem . The room was adequate for us, we had to carry ons 1 is large enough for this room. Shower was hot and strong. Place was clean. In vancover you sacrifice the area your in for a low priced room $50. We checked around and and it would be hard to find a room for less than a $100 per night. We spent the savings on bus tickets, food and drinks. There is pub there with an entrance to the left of the front desk. Food was good. Best deal in town is to buy the all day bus, sea bus and tram pass. $9. You can go any where, the markets were great. We headed to grouse mt sky ride but we didnt want to spend $80 for a ride up the hill, went back to the Market had lunch. The hot spot for us that love bars and a place to watch the games is on DENMAN STREET AND DAVIE STREET. China town is only 2 blocks from the hotel and it was worth the 4 visits i made. Keefer bar is a place to have a $8 drink in the evening. Some people will be intimitated by the area. Just relax and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a nice, safe location - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: danandnaomi
Reviews.Content: We were planning on staying here for three nights at the end of May. We booked this place based on the price as we are travelling on quite a tight budget, but immediately regretted our choice! We'd read a couple of reviews that said the location wasn't ideal, but it turned out to be a lot worse than anything we'd expected. Geographically the hotel is perfect distance from downtown Vancouver, being only a short walk, but the surrounding neighbourhood is scary! There is open drug use and prostitution right outside the hotel, all of the surrounding shops have bars on the windows which shows what kind of area it is. The hotel had parking, but it was by no mean's secure. It was in a public carpark right next to the hotel, with strange people walking through constantly. The room was ok, not the biggest, not the cleanest, but ok given the price. The staff on reception weren't too friendly, or rather they looked like they would rather be anywhere else (understandable given the neighbourhood!). All in all, the price was the reason we stayed there and it turned out to be a bad choice for us. I think if you are not someone to feel vulnerable in a bad neighbourhood, you would be ok here. But being two younger travellers this neighbourhood was genuinely scary. We moved out after the first night and stayed at the Days Inn hotel at Vancouver Airport. Very out of the way compared to the Patricia, and about double the price, but we loved it, and they have excellent public transport to downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap great value hotel for budget travellers!”
Reviews.Author: Kugsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights end of April beginning of May. We did not get to the hotel until the evening time. We walked here from downtown and up E.Hastings. Had a bit of a shock when we saw lots of homeless people all gathered around one area of the road. There was couple police cars there so we walked through them but we were invisible to them. No one spoke to us, no one asked us for anything which in our ignorance was what was gong through our minds. Anyway arrived at the hotel abit upset as thought where the hell have we booked. We only booked one night so thought just stay the night and leave next day. We booked the cheapest room they had, which is small and thin slide door to the bathroom so prob not best unless you are 'comfortable' with each other ;o) but at only $40 ish a night we were happy. We are travelling after all and we do not plan to stay ina room this was perfect for us. We decided to risk the pub next door and so glad we did. Really fab atmosphere,fantastic food, live music, one of the bests pub we have been to in a while. Anyway next day, the sun was shining, the street looked totally different we thought lets book the remainder of our 4 nights. So glad we stayed,We felt totally safe walking around, went to Gas town to eat which is only about 5-10min walk away, really nice. We never caught the bus even though it is outside, we walked everywhere. China town we gave a miss as just did not know where to go here. All I would say is dont be put off by first impressions, its safe hotel, great staff and great for a budget. We are going back in two weeks to stay again this time with my mum who is out to visit us and I would never take her anywhere I thought was unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: VerdeMan
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel. It was very clean and well kept up. We had a queen room. It was small but adequate for two. It had a shower and toilet in one small room, with the sink in the main room. Free WI-FI in the rooms and a comfortable bed ,If I had to pick anything negative it would be not too much space to store luggage. Everyone of the staff were very friendly and always ready to answer any questions about the area, places to visit and where to eat. The pub located in the same building is a good place to grab a burger or sandwich with a glass of their own brewed beer. All in all a very enjoyable stay. While not in the best area of town, we felt safe walking the streets day or night.. There is a bus stop across the street and the staff at the front desk will tell you what bus to take to get to your destination.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel tries hard but can't overcome East Hastings”
Reviews.Author: ChayaKagal
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the hotel aspires to be respectful....but it can't change the fact that it is on East Hastings. They gave us no problem when we cancelled our original 3 day reservation after 1 night and offered to store our luggage until a friend picked us up. We arrived late at night on "welfare Wednesday", with no clue about the area. We literally saw people sprawled on the sidewalk about every 10 or 20 feet. We've worked with homeless and mentally ill people in Toronto, and this was far worse than anything that we had ever experienced. Inside the room, there was no proper bathroom door, so while my partner was in there, I rode the elevator down to the lobby, accompanied by a couple of prostitutes. While in the lobby, I saw a couple of men carry in their drunk friend saying, "Don't worry buddy, this is a classy joint". It summed it up well - the classiest joint on skid row.

Reviews.Title: “Patricia Hotel & East Hastings”
Reviews.Author: M0NcHiT0
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Patricia Hotel this month and I had no regrets. Staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and places to visit, restaurants, stores, safety issues, etc. My bedroom was in the fifth floor with a nice view of downtown and East Hastings street. I know this hotel is located in a less desirable location in the city; however, I did not have any problems with street people during the day or at night. I did tons of walking from various places in downtown back to the hotel later at night and I felt safe. East Hastings Street is a different world and it is like being in the movies with all the issues going on in this part of Vancouver. I hope to return to Vancouver in the next couple of months and hope to spend another weekend at Patricia Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sjones25
Reviews.Content: if you are after clean, safe and value in a hotel, here it is. Small basic rooms at an exceptional price. Great service and friendly staff. Yes it is on Hastings E a very seedy part of the city, but your not hanging around here anyways, and remember this is Vancouver and these characters are everywhere. They don't usually bother anybody other than to beg a little and thats not anymore than in most major cities. We don't spend alot of time in our room or hotel so if you want a pool and other amenities, this is not your place. The bar and pub here makes as good a burger and fries as you will find anywhere and the prices are great. Don't be worried about staying here. If you just want a good clean cheap room and good access to the rest of Vancouver here it is and cheaper than anywhere else for a private room, even the hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SandyDandy1
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel with 5 star service. The front desk staff are very helpful & especially Mr Noordin is a solutions man. You can walk up-to him with any problem & he will fix it. He is a great asset to this hotel & I recon the guy deserves a pay-rise. He even took me around Vancouver on his day off. Now where do you get this. Although the neighborhood does not appear safe however most of these shady characters are too busy among themselves to bother you. I would suggest you keep walking & ignore them.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: johntylawson
Reviews.Content: Started a month in BC/Alberta in Vancouver and needed a cheap hotel. Read reviews and thought Patricia hotel would be ok. Location is good and the staff were so helpful from the start. Room not massive but adequate for a few days and clean with all the facilities we needed. After a long journey from uk the bar was great and gave us a great introduction to thegood company of the Canadian people. The beer and food was good too! Breakfast was plentiful and relaxed. Read thet the area is not good but no problem to us and the location is actually very good, being within easy walking distance to both chinatown and gastown. Even walked to Pacific Central with cases although there was always a taxi to hand and the bus route outside the hotel fine. Thanks to the chaps on the desk for good tourist tips!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: knull
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but they are clean and have everything you need for your stay. My last stay was for 6 nights and I was very comfortable (with only a fan and no A/C in July). The staff are very helpful and friendly. Sure the elevator is a trip but once you learn how to use it it's great fun! I have had to walk to the train at 5:30 in the morning on several ocassions (on previous trips) to get to the airport and never had a problem walking down Hastings. This last time I parked my car (very reasonable rates) at the hotel and left it there for 6 days - no problem. A little dose of reality can do us all a world of good and there are lots of good things happening in the East End - lots of hard working average people making a life for themselves and making life easier for others.

Reviews.Title: “smelly hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripit2010
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for one night,it was in a bad area of town and it was really old and the whole place smelt like death to be honest,the rooms were small and the beds horrible

Reviews.Title: “Refused to stay here”
Reviews.Author: trish-60
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver overnight to sail the next day. Other couple we travel with had another hotel booked, but we booked here since it was only for 1 night. As we got close to this hotel, we saw large numbers of people lying on the sidewalks, boarded up buildings, and even a drug buy taking place in the block next to the hotel. We felt very unsafe there, but when we talked to the desk clerk, he refused to cancel our reservation, even though it was the middle of the afternoon. We decided to check out the room. As we got to the 5th floor, the elevator did not even stop on the floor - we had to step down about 6 inches. The room was tiny, only about 18 inches on either side of a double bed and a few feet at the foot of the bed with a sink, table and 12" oscillating fan. We called and got a room elsewhere which cost us $250 but we would not stay at this hotel. We could not even get a cab to pick us up there so we just left and began to walk to another street where we hailed a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Preiswert und Sauber”
Reviews.Author: Mo_060810
Reviews.Content: Einfachs Hotel am Rande des Stadtzentrums, aber sauber und Preiswert. Das Frühstück war akzeptabel, da das Hotelpub aber unter Reneorvation war, fand unser Frühstück im dunklen statt. Einziges manko ist die Gegend wo sich das Hotel befindet. Es ist gerade am Rande des Stadtzentrums, wo sich die Bettler und Obdachlosen Szene aufhält. Gruss Mo

Reviews.Title: “Low price, clean rooms, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ainomiko
Reviews.Content: Agreed, the location is not ideal. East Hastings is an area of Vancouver that is one of the saddest in North America. But the people on the street are too busy being in the throes of addiction to bother you, the two verbal run-ins I had with people were both polite ("have a nice day lady" and "nice hair"). I walked past the area a few times as I explored town, a couple times by myself, and as a female did not feel that my personal safety was threatened. I just thought I would put my two cents about the area since so many people are concerned. Now onto the hotel itself, which is what I should be reviewing. At $69 a night for their budget room in the high season (where most hotels in Vancouver charge at least $100 more for one of their standard rooms), it is a steal of a deal. We checked in and the front desk staff were very polite and helpful. We had bikes with us and they have secure bike storage available on site. Their lobby has a mini library which is cool. As we reserved their cheapest room category, we expected a small room, and small it was. The room was extremely clean, though, which is all I cared about. As my partner was in town for business and I was there to meet up with friends and have fun, we were not planning on staying in the room for any long length of time during the day, so the size of the room was not an issue for us. It was quite hot the first two days we were there, but the open window/desk fan helped keep the temperature cool whenever we were in the room. The staff was friendly and courteous throughout our stay, and we had no issues whatsoever while staying here. Overall a great experience, and I recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and want a clean room with friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: inwatermelonsugar
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews online my friends and I were really nervous about staying at this hotel. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The condition of the neighborhood and the homeless people who hung around are exaggerated in other reviews, in our opinion. We are college age women from the U.S. and never felt particularly unsafe while inside or outside the hotel; no one harassed us. Frankly, the bad side of town in Vancouver is not that bad and the location allowed us to walk anywhere or easily take a bus. The staff was always very helpful and accommodating. There were no bugs. We had a standard room on the 4th floor; I can’t comment on other room types. It isn’t luxury but it is comfortable. Just don’t go on the 5th floor, there is no internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Totally works for a night in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: k_landsdowne
Reviews.Content: Three of us, two friends and myself, stayed at the Patricia Inn and it was great for the value. Yes it's in one of the worse neighbourhoods of Vancouver but you shouldn't be freaked out by the homeless people; they're actually far less persistent here than on Granville St (main shopping district). The blocks right around Main/Hastings are pretty bad. If you are looking for a touristy experience I don't really recommend it, but we wanted a place to stay for a night and the value was great, beds comfy, and clean! Staff are great as well and even the coffee machine was pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Not a family getaway”
Reviews.Author: Piperpilot66
Reviews.Content: This place is not for the faint at heart. This is the worst area Vancouver has to offer. All big cities have an area like this, and this is it. It goes for several blocks in each direction. The stores in the area (if you can call them stores) were protected with bars and most were abandoned. We arrived late Saturday night and witnessed open drug use and prostitution from our 5th floor window. There were people wandering around aimlessly in a drugged stupor (probably meth use). This lasted all night long. The hotel has a bar inside that played loud music until about 1 a.m. The hotel wasn't the worst thing I have ever stayed in, and even though it was very old, it seemed to be fairly clean. The rooms were tiny and very dated in the decor. There was a fan in the room with no a/c. We checked out the next morning and went to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good and clean”
Reviews.Author: christopher5
Reviews.Content: very good hotel clean,very nice staff awsome for the price, not a great part of the city, but my car was fine and no problems ,I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Service greatly ameliorated our experience!”
Reviews.Author: ____an0n_E_m0use____
Reviews.Content: We were in town to visit Vancouver, check out the paraolympics, and enjoy the Workless Party party. We chose the Budget Inn because of proximity to the party (just three blocks away!) and the low cost. The room was decent. We got everything we were promised, the room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. The in-room fridge proved very useful and the shower had good water pressure. All in all, an average experience. Here's what made the experience so much better: 1. Noor Din. This fellow, working the front desk, greeted us in a friendly manner every single time we came by with a question. He was a font of information, and provided us with countless insights into the local transit, entertainment, and cuisine. Noor Din went out of his way to make our visit more convenient and more enjoyable, and his efforts were very much appreciated. 2. The rate. While the website quoted significant rate increases for the paraolympics, a manager by the name of Chris not only gave us a decent room ( two queen beds) for a good price, he also offered us a 10% courtesy discount because we were all students (though this isn't policy and I doubt they'll repeat it, see below). Issues that Arose: 1. Our bill. The credit card machine didn't print out our receipt properly so they had to bill us a second time and assured me the first charge would be annulled at the end of the day. We won't know if the hold was effectively removed, or if the charge will be properly annulled, until we check out credit card bill next month. That's very annoying. I don't like having stressful tasks in my list. Additionally, there was no easy way to apply the 10% discount in the computer system and the manager on duty seemed (at first, at least) uncomfortable honoring it. While Noor Din made the stressful situation almost pleasant via his congenial nature and casual conversation, the manager on duty (not Chris) was aggressive both to his employee and to customers that tried to greet him. I don't know the situation (those clients might be problem cases, and/or the manager might have been having a stressful day) but it left me a little uncomfortable with leaving the bill correction to them. I will check online in a few days to make sure the charges are correct. 2. The location is a bit sketchy. Now, I'm a fairly laid-back individual and clearly something of socially uninhibited fellow (re: Workless Party) so I wasn't too bothered by the spattering of prostitutes and drug dealers every 10' down most of the side streets from the hotel. They didn't bother me, and I didn't bother them. A few blocks west on Hastings, however, is a more serious issue. We wanted to walk downtown and we didn't know the area so we progressed west along Hastings and found ourselves in sketch-town. Now, I want to be clear: no one accosted us, or even made any threatening gestures. Our anxiety was derived mostly from being outnumbered (50:1 at least) by people with values and priorities that do not align with ours (like obeying civil authority, and washing). We opted to move a block or two south and continue on Pender, which seemed to be a much cleaner and safer street. Oh, an aside, the Inn is connected to a pub that had live music. We didn't get a chance to check it out (we were only there one night), but it was convenient to have an indoor connection to a pub in case we did partake of the convenient boozing and wanted to come home late and wasted. Wouldn't really want to be wandering those streets at night and impaired.

Reviews.Title: “excellent low budget value”
Reviews.Author: kinyat
Reviews.Content: We've been reading all those reviews below and finally booked our stay there. Here's our impressions: The guys working the desk there couldn't be more helpful, friendly and accommodating. The place has a lots of 'old world' charm with its huge and cozy lobby, it might have seen better times but it is a simple clean place that delivers excellent value. The cheapest rooms (that's what we had) are small alright, don't have a view too, but have a comfy bed, a TV that works, and a bathroom w/ shower. It's a bit like those small, old hotels in Paris. Definitely not a Super6 or whatever hotel chain, and that's good. The location actually is very good with walking distance to Chinatown or Gastown. It's a mere 10 minute walk to the waterfront! Now there's the infamous east Hastings St. location. Well, that's life. Vancouver city hall concentrated their help and service stations for the down and out folks in an area of about blocks and if one decides to walk down Hastings St. one gets a reminder that there's folks out there having all kinds of troubles. That's OK! We've never been once asked for money or were inconvenienced in any way! It's easy and fast to get to the airport. With the bus/skytrain combination (bus stop is half a block from the hotel) it takes not more than 45 minutes. The skytrain (Canada line) is awsome btw. and if you want to save some money, buy a 10 pack of tickets at the drugstore in the Domestic Terminal arrival hall level 1 - this way you'll save on the 5 dollar 'add-on' fee city hall cooked up! Conclusion: it's not a Hilton by any means, but the value is exceptional. Highly recommended! Another thing: WiFi is free and included but does not work on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: gln126
Reviews.Content: We read and heard it was a terrible location with prostitutes and drug addicts before our trip to Vancouver. However, we arrived at 2 a.m. in the morning. Grabbed a cab from the airport and got there for CAN$33. In the morning, we walked around the area. Chinatown is only a block west from the hotel. Those people didn't bother us. I guess coming from New York, it was nothing scary about the neighborhood. It took us only 15 minutes to walk east to Ballantyne Pier. The hotel is located at a main street so there was nothing to worry about. This is a no thrill no frill hotel. We would not mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not contemplate staying in this neighbourhood-----scary”
Reviews.Author: kellysworld
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at hotel. Once i saw neighborhood, i cancelled. Very scary area during the day, would not go there at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: timyuen
Reviews.Content: I am in the Ieong family and I think it's pretty good. The pub was great and the staff were great too! I mean it's hard to even get 1 star for a hotel. And it feels just like a 5 star hotel in the lobby chairs. Let me just tell you from the start. First we found the hotel and the staff found our room. Then we went into our room and it was kind of hot in there. Maybe it's because of the mini fridge. Anyway, we went playing outside everyday and it was near the places we went. Like, Gastown, Chinatown, Police Museum, and bus stops and Canada Line and lots more. Also inside the room was neat but a little noisy. The bathroom was good and so are the beds. You can also do Laundry in the Basement. AND the BEST thing was that the tv had cable! The cartoon channels are 27, 50, and 49. There are some news too! There might be some on 70. And here is a little tip, there is some homeless people out there and they might ask you for money, if that happens, just pretend you don't know anything. And they won't hurt you. Here is one last tip, I would not drive a car, someone might break into it. So just ride public transporation. If you want to save money, just buy a ticket to Canada Line, then you can use it on other public transporations too within 90 minutes. So just enjoy this hotel, it's price is good and it is even when you buy it on a season rate special. It has a good view on the top floors. Also the small rooms have a park view, but the big rooms have a street view. And the roads were just built so it is good to walk on.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, clean and friendly, but bad smoky smell”
Reviews.Author: cansui
Reviews.Content: Good stay for a cheap price. Friendly, helpfull staff, clean room which unfortunately smelled terribly smoky (though we got it sold as a non-smoking room). Breakfast Buffet for that low price was a surprise (next to a choice of Kelloggs, they even offered different muffins,)! The car parking next to the hotel was ok, nothing happened to our vehicle (probably because the car was some dirty it didn't look that inviting for any thiefs :). During our stay they started a special on rates. Accordingly we added a night to profit. The clerk tried his best but the management denied it afterwards. This was kinda disappointing... As expected by former reviews the neighbourhood was pretty bad (drugs, prostitutes, homeless people) but could be avoided by using the car or walking on Pender instead of Hastings.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, let down by the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: 66Traveller
Reviews.Content: True, we were a bit shocked when a friend told us to look out for the drug addicts in this area. But at least they came as no surprise ... And they didn't bother us, though we did take the precaution of taking ALL potentially removable accessories off our bikes, which we then chained together in the car park. Our room was tiny. Though perhaps not in the most deluxe condition, it was clean. It had a good shower, the bed was comfortable, and the linen and towels were of good quality. To be fair, it would have been less cramped had we not chosen to bring all our motorcycle luggage into the room. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only real problem for this hotel is the neighbourhood, which could be off-putting, if you weren't expecting it. For open-minded people, who are looking for a convenient budget hotel for a short stay, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: FISFIS
Reviews.Content: I'm a freelance reporter who works out of Montreal. Occasionally I need to travel for work related purposes. On my most recent trip I decided to save some money and give the Partricia Hotel a chance. I was pleasantly surprised; the hotel is immaculate and the service is wonderful. The staff are very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “crime and disease rampant at the patricia, despite friendly service”
Reviews.Author: intrepidvoyageur
Reviews.Content: 1. My vehicle was broken into on the first night, despite being empty. This is a nightly occurrence according to residents at the Patricia and regulars at the pub which shares the parking lot. 2. After sleeping there two nights I developed a large dark red rash across my back. 3. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. 4. The plumbing is preposterous and almost impossible to use. Handles come off in your hand and any appliance involving threaded piping is completely stripped. 5. The bathroom "door" is a flimsy sliding piece of plastic, AND it's broken. In the end, for the price I was happy, UNTIL the additional $300 USD for replaced window, glass everywhere in my car, stolen contents, victimized feeling, unsafe feeling, 2nd sleepless night, and take-home skin rash. Don't let this neighborhood and accommodation ruin Vancouver for you - stay far away.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozbear40
Reviews.Content: Not having been to Vancouver before I booked a hotel via the net and went with price. The hotel is basic and for the price was OK but for travellers to Vancouver that have not been there before i would suggest not staying in this area. It didn't feel safe at all and this is no reflection on the hotel as the staff where great, helpful and friendly, and the place was clean and comfortable and it is a shame that the area is as it is.

Reviews.Title: “If you're not streetwise or travel savvy you may be unprepared.”
Reviews.Author: etranze
Reviews.Content: First of all I'll stick with some of the main points then on to the details. Pros: -Walking distance to Chinatown, Downtown, Ports and Transit. -Friendly and knowledgeable staff -Easy access to Public Transit (During 6am-2am) -Room service about 930am-10am in cases multilingual staff Cons: -If you have a window room, it will be 6-10 degrees colder -If you're business requires you to be on-call 24 hrs you'll have trouble getting around, or getting to an ATM - E.Hastings is notorious for having a high frequency of disadvantaged people (Prostitutes, Junkies, Homeless and so on) not Patricia's fault, but something to be aware of if you are not prepared. Background: I was in Vancouver for a couple days on business, very last minute due to economic shifts that affected my employer in Toronto. So out of the blue I booked with travelocity without incident, Patricia had everything on file and took a copy of credit card for incidentals. Price comparison is that of a backpackers hostel, considering that you get privacy, some amenities and such, the price is a steal. The Hotel: There is a single elevator that's a little older you may have to push the buttons twice or so. Once I got to my room i noticed that it was quite cold, I found a piece of wood propping the window open for some reason, once removed it did get warmer, but only slightly during my entire stay(3 days-2 nights). Budget room has a 2 piece bathroom with a pretty straight forward shower and toilet while the sink is in the main part of the room. Cable TV is pretty easy and free while phone is for pay (I run everything through my cell so i didn't really need it anyway). I noticed that a few local payphones have been vandalized beyond use either stripped for parts or just plain broken so if you need a phone I would suggest you get a disposable from 7-11 or use long distance phone cards with your cell phone. If you are the Business type bring a laptop there is no cybercafe in about a 2 km radius. From what I understand they have a wireless internet setup, since I haven't tested it I can't really say much more. I travel light and with as few electronics as possible and I learned this the hard way. Locale: There are really no attractions in the immediate area aside from Chinatown and the Ports, there's a waterfront park nearby and some others just south if you need a place to get some air, smoke or what not. Due to certain elements in the area, businesses close up shop rather early if you're comparing it to a 24 hr city like Toronto, Tokyo, LA, or New York this borough of Vancouver isn't up to snuff . Translink information is mostly online and in select bus shelters, if you're a tourist you will have trouble finding maps or finding out where you can get them considering the major lines are either automated or under equipped. Every map holder i saw while traveling on the Skytrain was empty, i had to draw a mini map in my padfolio from one encased in a bus shelter at one point. Okay, now on to what most of you have been griping about. Yes this area is not for the faint of heart, if drug dealers, hookers, and homeless people scare you then don't stay in this part of town. I use to be a youth worker so this is kind of my element, I can diffuse hostile situations if necessary, but remember if you show them respect they will too. Try not to judge them or tell them off, a simple no thanks or not right now can go a long way. Also, try to dress casual; I had to maintain a dress code for some parts of my trip and walking around at odd hours in business attire is a sure fire way to get propositioned by prostitutes and those looking for spare change. Police presence increases substantially after 2am, from what I gather there are 2 easily accessible stations, if by any chance you do meet with an aggressive panhandler or other persons facing barriers. Quite frankly you have better chances bribing the homeless for lost or stolen property they know more and act much quicker; helped fellow out of towner find lost keys in less than 10 min with homeless guys help. Conclusion: The only way I would stay in this Hotel again, is if my employer would agree to some concessions, including a rather sizable increase in pay. I know I have to go back to Vancouver for a progress report next year and I plan on staying closer to the Downtown core possible in a brand name hotel and renting a car to get around during the early hours. If you're a last minute traveler and value a half decent quiet environment without a lot of money this is definitely a place for you. Roadies, traveling artists, and temporary job seekers from out of province would probably benefit most. Be smart, prepared, and try not to antagonize anyone and you'll do fine.

Reviews.Title: “Please Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lookin4htls
Reviews.Content: Warning travellers to not stay here. Wish I could post a worldwide comment for all international guests as the website is so deceiving. Our travel agency downtown has heard nothing but complaints from guests staying at this hotel (who have booked privately) - terrible area. Right near Main and Hastings which is notorious for being "skidrow". Soooo many other affordable places to stay in Vancouver, please don't judge Vancouver if you have stayed at this property. I have heard many people not wanting to come back to Vancouver after staying in this particular area. I am Vancouver born and raised and would NOT feel safe walking around or even near this area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Adams050
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through American Express with a vacation deal. We called American Express back after the vacation suggest them not to carry this hotel on their list. Besides the room, the disdurbing neighborhood, the hotel staffs attempted three time to double charge us for the room. First, when we arrived, the front desk clerk asked for a credit card, we said it's been paid for when we booked the vacation, but the clerk insisted for secrity. When we left, the front desk clerk printed out the invoice and asked for payment for the room, we explained again. When we received the next bill from American Express, guess what, an extra charge showed on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Take the next block”
Reviews.Author: Miss088
Reviews.Content: As described, this is a budget hotel so don't expect too much. The rooms are small but the showers are really powerful and the staff are friendly. The only problem is the crack heads, drunks and homeless people who live just down the road. They aren't the least bit interested in you but its not the best side of Vancouver. We found if you walk into the city centre via China town you feel safer.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever!”
Reviews.Author: WriterInk
Reviews.Content: If hookers and drug dealers plying their trades in the parking lot is your idea of a great family ambience, then this is the place for you. If not, then I suggest you find someplace else to stay. The inside of this shabby establishment was almost as bad as the outside and the treatment was even worse. Our family requested a non-smoking room when we reserved because our son has asthma . Despite the smoky stench in the lobby, we decided to look at our room anyhow because we were exhausted after a full day of traveling and hoped it would be clean. After taking our credit card number, the proprietor informed us that he’d neglected to mention the elevator was broken – and our room was on the fourth floor! We lugged our heavy suitcases up four flights of stairs, only to discover that our room stank of smoke, was west-facing, had no air conditioning and was so hot as to be a virtual sweatbox. In short, it was simply not habitable. We hauled everything back down the stairs. I have a chronic disk problem in my neck from an old injury which was already hurting from dragging stuff up four flights. The manager insisted he would NOT return our money and that we would be charged for the room if we left. I pointed out that he had no right to keep our money since we’d been misled about our room, and since nobody could expect someone with a neck/back condition to hike up and down four flights every time we wanted to leave the hotel. In the U.S., this would be a clear violation of access for the disabled laws. I had no free hands since I was carrying a heavy duffel bag downstairs. On the last level, I slipped on the too-slick polished stairs and fell down, wrenching my lower back. The manager/proprietor, who was right behind me, didn’t even apologize or ask if I was alright, just kept insisting he wouldn’t refund our money. We were furious and shocked at the callous and inconsiderate attitude. My son then opened up his laptop in the lobby, got online and booked us a room at a much-better hotel across town for less money. When the proprietor noticed what we were doing, the wireless Internet connection mysteriously went down. But fortunately we’d already put down a deposit and reserved our new room. When we informed the proprietor of this rat hole that we were leaving and would definitely not accept the room offered, he again insisted that he would not refund our money. By this time my husband had loaded up all of our four family member’s heavy suitcases in our rental vehicle. My back was hurting and we couldn’t wait to leave. Then the proprietor informed us that the elevator was fixed, however both my son and I were affected by the smoky air in the lobby and we were all so offended by how we’d been treated that I called our credit card company and told them about the abuse, asking to have charges removed. The card company representative offered to cancel our card before the charges were put through, but we couldn’t as we needed it for the rest of our vacation. So I informed the representative that we would be challenging any charges from the Budget Patrician. I also asked a desk clerk to write down my complaints in their guest book. My back continued to bother me for the next week, but it wasn’t until the last day of our vacation that I was able to book an appointment for a massage at the April Point Resort & Spa to relieve the pain. Thankfully the damage was not permanent, but it did lessen my ability to enjoy what remained of our vacation. We are now appealing this charge with our credit card company. If anything, the Budget Inn Patricia should be compensating us for the physical pain and extreme inconvenience we suffered as a result of this nightmare experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sucks!!!!!Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: seigh
Reviews.Content: Please dont make the mistake that we did. We took this hotel because it was chaep and we took it as a part of the airline ticket deal. However, if you can spend 10-20 bucks more, you can get some better place. The rooms had a very bad smell. The bed sheets had stains and they were not clean. The service was poor. Terrible place to stay even for 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: quattromonti
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ok but really basic. The hotel is located in a very degraded area so it's dangerous to come back late. On the other hand the price is one of the best you can get in Vancouver for a pritty central location!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelite
Reviews.Content: I have never before written a review regarding a hotel – good or bad. But on this occasion I feel that it is a social obligation to do so. My absolute honest advice is to stay away. I repeat: stay away from this hotel. There are literally hoards of drug addicts and prostitutes outside the hotel (and also frequent the lobby). It is one of the worst areas I have seen for this kind of depravation, and I’ve travelled all over the US. Whatever anyone says this cannot be a safe environment for a visitor. We arrived and then rapidly found alternative accommodation. If the hotel were in another area, I wouldn’t be so down on it, but really – look for somewhere else if you value your property and your safety.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room for Hostel prices.”
Reviews.Author: two_trippers
Reviews.Content: We love Vancouver and have been here 7+ times. This was our first stay at Hotel Patricia, and I was very happy!! We started with a room at the side, which was a little on the small side, but we asked to be transferred and got a nice big room at the front of the building. It was a little noisier, especially with the window open, but we didn't mind - still quiet enough to sleep. The area is a little rough, compared w Aust and European standards. Vancouverites (?) seem have a more liberal approach to their citizens - more of a live and let live attitude - and more likely a more humanitarian approach, then locking unsightly their people up. We were asked for money once or twice, but we found even the strangest of characters didn't pose too much of a threat. Our car was a brand new rental, we left it in the car park every night and it was fine. (on a previous trip we had our car broken into so many times, we ended up leaving it unlocked to avoid broken windows - and this was in a "safe" part of downtown). It is close enough to downtown to hoof it around, prop 1/2 hour walk to Stanley Park. There is a pub - we had breakfast there - no complaints. Beer was cheap at night too. Of all the places we have stayed in Vancouver this is our fav. The front desk staff were ace - can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel with a great pub”
Reviews.Author: xalapaj
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for European style budget accommodation, it doesn't get any better than this in Vancouver. Of course it's close to Main and Hastings, and the staff is up front about that when you call them. But it has clean and tidy rooms, it's quiet, and the staff are friendly and helpful. And the price is unbelievable for Vancouver. It's also right on a major bus route, so if you want to avoid all the action three blocks down, you can. And as an added bonus, the pub downstairs is absolutely fantastic. When we were there, there was a rockabilly theme night going on, with people pulling up in 50s era cars, and the bands were awesome, sort of like the Stray Cats. Beer is cheap, the crowd was chill, and the venue itself feels like an old jazz bar, it's a great layout. I don't know what some of the other travellers commenting on this hotel were expecting. Sounds like they were looking for a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Is OK Place To Stay, Not Kidding....”
Reviews.Author: PieHole99
Reviews.Content: I go to Vancouver frequently and my last trip, 13-19 September 2007, I'd waited until last minute to book accomodations. Of course, the place(s) I'd preferred to stay was booked, so I was left scrambling to find a place. I chose this hotel on a whim. I was familiar with the area and thought since I wouldn't be staying at the place much, it wouldn't be such a big deal. Anyway, once I got to Van, I decided to walk to the Pat Hotel straight down Hastings. Hahahahaaa, it was no different of course from what I know about the east end of the city, and to tell you the truth, East Hastings can be really troublesome if you're a bit worrisome about perceived crime/homelessness/drugs/etc .... and East Hastings is the place that most people try to avoid it seems in Van. You know what, the hotel is fantastic! It's safe, clean, friendly ..... my room was the best I could've imagined. Some people say the rooms are small ...... well, compared to European hotels I've stayed at, I'd say The Pat's rooms are huge by comparison. Oh, just avoid East Hastings when walking to/from The Pat by walking down East Pender thru Chinatown (next parallel street) ..... it's like night/day. I'd stay at The Pat again. In fact, my previous choices on Robson, or West End ....... the value is at The Pat if you enjoy a bit of extra walking, whatnot. Great Find :)

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay cheap in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: kishmy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend here and were pleasantly surprised. We had read some of the other reviews regarding the area and decided to call the hotel and ask about it since every place else was really expensive. The clerk basically said that some of the people in the area kind of looked bad, but the area was really safe and we wouldn’t have a problem. When we checked in the clerk recommended that we not walk all the way down the main street, but suggested we go through Chinatown (right across the street) to get to the middle of downtown. Getting to Gastown was no problem either. If you haven’t been to Vancouver, there is a stretch that starts about 4 blocks from the hotel that runs between Gastown and Chinatown towards downtown that looked pretty crappy and worth avoiding, we walked right in the middle of it when we cut through from Chinatown to Gastown. The hotel itself was nice and clean even though it’s older and the staff was really nice. No A/C unfortunately, but there is a fan in the room and it was cool enough to sleep at night. I would also recommend upgrading from the budget room. It was super cheap but quite small and it has no view. The room we ended up with was a lot bigger with a great view and even had an old claw foot tub, plus breakfast was included. I can see why some people don’t like the area, but again we had no problems and the hotel was just fine. We did see homeless type people and some prostitutes as well as tons of little old men and women from Chinatown that didn’t seem too worried about them. Overall, a great place to stay if you want to save money, as long as you don’t over react about the area.

Reviews.Title: “So greatful my car did not get broken into!”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime_7
Reviews.Content: Everything the other reviews say is true. The rooms are oh, SOOOO small (the average japanese hotel room is larger than the room we stayed in !!!). My husband didn't sleep at all because he kept looking out the window, just in case someone tried to break into our car. We slept on top of the covers and did not dear to place our bags on the floor for fear of bedbugs. We arrived at about 2 AM; by 6AM we are up again and out the door! I guess it is OK if you absolutely cannot afford spending another $15-$30 CAN per night for an upgrade a few blocks away. In our case, for another $30/night we were able to stay at the Sandman, a very nice 3 star hotel in the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel but bad bad area”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles1608
Reviews.Content: Well where to start. We had a nice scenic cab ride to the hotel and we were plesantly supsrised. We then got to the hotel and all our dreams were slightly shattered, this hotel is probably located in the worst area of Vancouver. There were plenty of people just happy to sleep in doorways and constantly ask you for money. Hence we did not stay long at all in fact i think we lasted about 1/2 hr and found alternative accommodation on Granville Street (this is downtown Vancouver). If you want a cheap hotel and you dont mind being asked for money to feed peoples habits then this is the hotel for you! Having said this though the staff were very helpful. This hotel maybe suitable for a group of guys but for two girls on their own i am sorry but i cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel in bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: whateveritis
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel locates at poor neighborhood. But the hotel per se is pretty good and safe for a budget inn. Actually this hotel is listed with other major hotels by the vancouver tourism map. Plus, staff members in this hotel are very freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “How the other half live”
Reviews.Author: Gadaboutgran
Reviews.Content: I was assured by telephone that the hotel was basic but clean but that it was a fair walk from the centre of downtown Vancouver and that it was in close proximity to china Town. This is a very accurate description. However, on arrival, the sight of so many drug addicts, prostitutes and other poor members of society in the immediate area was very upsetting and intimidating. Needless to say I did not linger and found alternative accommodation ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Budget inn for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: livin_n_the_city
Reviews.Content: Hi, I've stayed several times in the last few months and will probably stay there again. It's a budget hotel, hard to beat the price ($39 CAD in low season), especially for the single traveler. The hotel is clean but can be shabby -- especially the really budget rooms I'd ask for. The area is rough -- due west on Hastings is a very seedy part of town for drug dealers/prostitutes, etc. I've never had a problem, but I'm a big guy, and I also never walked around there after dark (except to the little Vietnamese cafe across the street). If dodgy areas or street people put you off at all, this is not the place for you. It is easy walking distance to Chinatown (I was there over Lunar New Year last year) or Gastown, & I'd never worry about or think twice about walking in day time. Right on a main bus line that takes you into the central downtown, Gastown if you don't want to walk, or out east to Commercial Drive. Parking fee in the lot next door was nominal, I think $2/day, & I think free on the side streets (tho I'm not sure I'd trust my car on the streets away from the main drag given the population around there). Don't know about car break-ins, first time I asked to make sure my car would be safe & they assured me it would be. I've had my car there 3 times & no problem. I've found the staff to be friendly and informative, & they have take out menus of area restaurants that will deliver. Pub next door brews its own beer on premises & it's pretty good, I would stop back for a beer even if I don't end up staying there again. They have general pub fare that isn't bad, but they stop serving food at 8 pm. All in all, you get what you pay for, and how long do you stay in a hotel room when on vacation, anyway, is my philosophy. AC & TV w/ cable in all the rooms I've been in.

Reviews.Title: “Give this a miss”
Reviews.Author: flem3547
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the worst location in downtown Vancouver. It is the wrong side of Main Street with drugs and homeless people a plenty. The hotel is satisfactory but it is old. The rooms are very small with " bathroom" in one corner. The only good thing about this hotel is price. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to book...if you don't mind crackheads”
Reviews.Author: bikegrrl62
Reviews.Content: I am a photojournalist who averages 10 to 15 visits yearly to BC to cover sporting events and shoot with BC-based athletes. Because of this, I have a long list of accommodations available to me throughout the province. But this Labour Day weekend, my plans changed suddenly, and I was forced to find a hotel in Vancouver for Saturday night with virtually no notice. None of my usual spots had rooms available. So I started researching possibilities. My usual accommodations, even though they're in lovely neighbourhoods like Kits, and have hot tubs, great breakfasts and safe, comfortable, clean rooms, usually run me $60-$80 nightly. So when other B&Bs and hotels in the core area were quoting $150+ nightly, I started expanding my scope. I checked out the TripAdvisor reviews for the Patricia, and was concerned that many were negative. But the provincial tourism agency told me that there were "some" homeless people in the area, and while I wouldn't want to hang out in that part of town, that I should be fine. That was the worst travel advice I have ever received. When I drove from Lion's Gate into Gastown, I expected to find the hotel soon, as it was advertised to be "steps" from Gastown. Not only was it not near Gastown, it was significantly east of Chinatown - in the one area of Vancouver that concerns me, an urban-dwelling journalist who has ventured with minimal worries, late at night, through tough areas of NYC, London, LA and Bangkok. Driving through the area where the Patricia is located requires constant attention to avoid running over crackheads and tweakers who stumble unexpectedly across the street. Regrettably, I did not recognize the neighbourhood from the address. When I pulled into the lot next door to the hotel, I prayed that they had another parking facility, as the parking had been advertised as "secure" with video cameras. Unfortunately, that was not the case. In reality, it was an open lot with sketchy individuals everywhere. As best as I can tell, the only benefit of the cameras would be for the police to review crimes that had already been committed. There is a huge difference between "homeless" individuals who may or may not be dangerous versus crack and meth addicts who are universally known as likely candidates to be thieves stealing to feed their habits. Furthermore, when I mentioned my concern about the parking and about the spotty locks on the rooms, the front desk clerk huffed at me that "no one would break into my room." Well, given that he was in the back of the front desk area, out of sight of anyone entering the lobby or going up the elevator, I was not so confident. And I really didn't want to mention that I was concerned because I had $10K of very-portable camera gear with me. Beyond that, my "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke. Though, in fairness, it seemed clean if a bit ratty.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this one...”
Reviews.Author: Ericka98125
Reviews.Content: The price was okay...under $100/night but for the same price we could of stayed somewhere more centrally located. I don't recommend staying here if you're a single woman traveling alone. The rooms were clean but the neighborhood is not safe at night. There were drug addicts, prostitutes and drunks wandering around. It's close to Chinatown (which is nothing spectacular) but a bit of a walk to everywhere else. Luckily we had rented a car (parking available onsite). We passed the gastown hostel and regretted not staying there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you absolutely have to”
Reviews.Author: generalgeneral
Reviews.Content: the rooms were okay, and the hotel was nice and clean, but the neighborhood is one of the worst i've seen, and i've been all over seattle, southern california and new york city. People shooting up on the streets, public urination in broad daylight, a horrible neighborhood that no tourist should stay in. My car was broken into on the one and only night I was there, nothing was stolen and the damage was minor but it was still frustruating. If you stay here make sure you have an alarm system on your car or park somewhere more secure, the lot has cameras/patrols but that didn't help me. Only stay here if you can't afford anywhere else and you aren't using your own transportation, i'd advise taking taxi's to downtown proper, especially at night

Reviews.Title: “Can not beat the price”
Reviews.Author: RSVPTravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I expected what I saw...which was beggars, homeless people and maybe some prostitutes. But, for $45-49.00 a night in Vancouver, I was Happy. Let me start by saying "I am a frequent traveler". I love paying less for more. Armed with the information from trip advisor, I was ready for the neighborhood. The rooms are dorm or nunnary sized. But it was cleaned everyday, Parking is available for pennies or nothing at all. I can't even remember the price. public transportation was directly infront of the hotel. They also had tour companies picking up at the hotel. --With the money I saved istaying at this hotel (June 30-July 3), I shopped at Guess, BeBe's, Armani exchange, etc, and ate at some really great restaurants. For me, I broke even. If I had stayed at the Hyatt, Marriot, etc--McDonald's would have seen me for every meal. Plus, the hotel sells all day bus tickets for $8. The normal day fare is $2 or 2.50. It has Cable TV but no remote....o.k. Friendly Staff. I saw couples at the hotel, but no children. I never felt danger while I was there. But, I am happy I left the kids at home.
