Besides, Vancouver is beautiful, but expensive. I plan on returning to Vancouver and will stay at this hotel again. ...If I can get the Holiday Inn or another hotel for $100 or less, well I will stay there. Otherwise, " Patricia Here I come"!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Moaners, a Good Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must admit that the location of the Budget Patricia is not the best but I found the hotel to be more then what I expected from a 'budget' hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. As for it's location, yes it is full of the homeless, drug addicts and prostitutes but in the 5 days I was there I was never accosted by anyone. I even walked into the city and back again via Gastown and felt fairly safe albeit with a friend. When I was accosted by beggars, which only happened in Gastown, I never gave them anything but instead of the verbal abuse I've received in other large cities, I was told instead to have a nice day, or enjoy your stay (obviously a politer beggar/drug user/drunk inhabits Vancouver!). For those who complain, yes the Patricia should be a bit more upfront about it's location but remember it is a Budget hotel and what were you expecting - A harbour view at Canada Place for $80?! Get Real!!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to be economical and not waste money while you sleep, this is the best choice for Vancouver lodging. If you mind freaks around the hotel, sleeping in antique rooms on antique furniture with lumpy pillows, get another hotel. Before renting a room for two nights, I read a few reviews. They were accurate to say that there are questionable personalities around in the area - not so much unsafe but rather strange, people with bizarre habits, behaviour, clothing. The hotel is a few blocs into a rather depressed area. Once inside the hotel, everything is o'kay and if all you care is to save some money, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you don't mind deros as your neighbours”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravelers
Reviews.Content: It's amazing how where you stay, can really affect your impression of a city. We made the mistake of booking this place online. It seemed fairly central to the city and was reletively cheap. Little did we know that it was in one of the scungiest areas in Vancouver. This area (East Hastings Street) appeared to be the main hangout for, druggies, homeless people and people with mental problems. Not only that most of them seemed to catch the bus with us! For some reason, all you needed to say to get a free ride on the bus was "I' just need to pick up my social security cheque" oh.. and not washing for a few months would help and muttering to yourself a lot. It was a pretty unpleasant experience and you definately did not want to walk around at night in the dark. I was even more worried when I bus driver I was talking to said we'd be fine as long as we carried Mace with us .. and he wasn't kidding. In terms of the hotel itself. The rooms were small and a little smoky smelling (even though it was meant to be non- smoking) - what you'd expect from a budget hotel. The rooms were clean and were cleaned daily. I didn't see any cockroaches or vermin in the room which I guess is a bonus! The staff were really nice, friendly and helpful. We had a lovely view of a vacant lot from our window where we got a really good view of all the crack dealers supplying their clients (okay maybe that was just my imagination but there were people loitering a lot there), in addition to the lovely aroma of pot in the lift one day. Before I went to Vancouver, I was told it was a fantastic place but I have to say after staying at the Patricia Inn I didn't have the fabulous experience of Vancouver I thought I would. Unless you're into experiencing some of the more 'colourful' locals and the seedier side of Vancouver then stay away from this place like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, to everyone complaining that the rooms are small and dirty and old and that it's not in a great neighbourhood, what do you really expect for under $100 a night in downtown Vancouver? I personally did not find this to be the case at all actually, and the hotel definitely exceeded my expectations: the rooms were a lot cleaner and better kept up than I would have expected of a hotel like this. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful, Pat's Pub offers an average complimentary breakfast, and as for the neighbourhood, it may be a sad sight to see at times but I personally found nothing unsafe about it from my own experiences. I walked through there at all hours of the night and day on my own and never experienced any problems. A satisfactory stay for me and my lady overall.

HotelInfo.Name: Budget Inn Patricia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 403 East Hastings, Vancouver, British Columbia V6A 1P6, Canada
